Title: A technical report on PIPA Project: A cloud and mobile based application for measuring and controlling electricity use at Indonesian houses
Source title: Vision 2020: Sustainable Growth, Economic Development, and Global Competitiveness - Proceedings of the 23rd International Business Information Management Association Conference, IBIMA 2014
Authors with affiliations: Geumpana, T.A., Binus International, Jakarta, Indonesia; Widjaja, N.D., Binus International, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This project is a fully funded project by Information Society Innovation Fund (ISIF) Asia which aims to develop a cloud and mobile based application to capture the electricity consumption data for every area of a typical Indonesian household without having to modify the electricity meter from PLN (National Energy Company). In Indonesia, people cannot track the electricity home use since PLN bills only display total price. Currently, people cannot control devices (turn on/off) from outside of the house, which if possible, will lead to electricity savings. Interviews, literature research and experiments have been conducted to develop the prototype of the system. For the hardware; Arduino Board and Current Transformator are used to capture the data about electricity consumption in every room in the house. Meanwhile, an online application is designed using PHP in cloud platform. After receiving the data, it will be sent to the cloud server so that the user can see the report in the form of chart and graph for each room through a laptop or computer with Internet access. Switching on and switching off a lamp in the house can also be controlled through either Android mobile application or computer. This feature is expected to give a smarter way for the users to monitor and control their electricity consumption at home. The software has been tested in a small prototype house, which consists of 1 or 2 rooms that may have one lamp, TV, AC, and desktop computer or anything similar to it.
Author Keywords: Arduino for home automation; Cloud monitoring application; Energy saving application; Mobile control application
Index Keywords: Competition; Electronic document exchange; Information management; Software testing; Cloud monitoring; Electricity-consumption; Home automation; Information society; Literature researches; Mobile controls; Monitor and control; On-line applications; Houses

Title: Location-based social networking media for restaurant promotion and food review using mobile application
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, 12270 Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Luhur, H.S., Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, 12270 Jakarta, Indonesia; Widjaja, N.D., Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, 12270 Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper is focusing on the development of a mobile application for searching restaurants and promotions with location based and social networking features. The main function of the application is to search restaurant information. Other functions are also available in this application such as add restaurant, add promotion, add photo, add food review, and other features including social networking features. The restaurant and promotion searching application will be developed under Android platform. Upon completion of this paper, heuristic evaluation and usability testing have been conducted. The result of both testing shows that the application is highly usable. Even though there are some usability problems discovered, the problems can be eliminated immediately by implementing the recommendations from the expert evaluators and the users as the testers of the application. Further improvement made to the application will ensure that the application can really be beneficial for the users of the application. © Owned by the authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2014.
Author Keywords: Digital dashboard management; DSS; Model; Simulation; System dynamic

Title: A review of factors influencing user satisfaction in Indonesia's online newspaper
Source title: Proceedings of the International Conference on Electronic Business (ICEB)
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Binus University International - Binus Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Widjaja, N.D., School of Information Systems, Binus University International - Binus Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Tanoey, N., School of Information Systems, Binus University International - Binus Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study examined the correlation between information (content, accuracy, format, and timeliness), system (ease of use) and two additional factors i.e pricing and environment toward user satisfaction in Indonesia's online newspaper based on Doll and Torkzadeh framework. The benefit of this research is to facilitate current online newspaper providers to be more focus on factors that contribute to user satisfaction thus can increase its quality and user satisfaction as well. Furthermore, it is also purposed to endorse newspaper to have online version and facilitate them on what factors contribute to user satisfaction so they can go online with competitive advantage along with the existence online newspaper providers. The study identified three factors that influence Indonesia's online newspaper user satisfaction such as content, ease of use, and pricing.
Index Keywords: Competitive advantage; Ease-of-use; Indonesia; Online newspaper; Online versions; User satisfaction; Competition; Electronic commerce; Internet; Websites

Title: 3D product viewer for e-commerce applications
Source title: Proceedings of the International Conference on Electronic Business (ICEB)
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Binus International University - Binus Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Binus International - Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Widjaja, N.D., School of Information Systems, Binus International University - Binus Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Adi, E., School of Computer Science, Binus International - Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Despite its huge potential to promote merchandise transactions over the internet, Indonesia does not have enviable e-commerce traffic. The aim of the project is to promote the culture of online shopping in Indonesia, with the benefit of increasing the revenue for the network and content providers. Furthermore, the survey would benefit the Computer-Human Interface interests since it shows that a 3D interaction increases customer's willingness to buy. The 3D viewer application is developed with Adobe Flash and Sandy 3D engine. The technology was chosen in such as way that it uses a ubiquitous solution. Its advantage over the currently existing solutions is that the viewer can be embedded to any web page seamlessly. The study conducted a survey and found that the 3D viewer fulfills its initial purpose and is easy enough to be used.
Index Keywords: 3D engine; 3D interactions; 3D viewers; Computer human interface; Content providers; E-Commerce applications; Indonesia; Online shopping; Human computer interaction; Surveys; Three dimensional computer graphics; Electronic commerce

Authors: Widjaja N.D., Imam K., Mariani M.
Title: A study of Green IT awareness among IT professionals in Indonesia
Source title: Business Transformation through Innovation and Knowledge Management: An Academic Perspective - Proceedings of the 14th International Business Information Management Association Conference, IBIMA 2010
Authors with affiliations: Widjaja, N.D., Binus International University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Imam, K., Binus International University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Mariani, M., Binus International University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The awareness of IT professionals to Green IT is important to be studied in order to measure whether they are ready to implement Green IT or not. Many countries already implemented Green IT initiatives to reduce carbon emissions. Studied about the level of awareness of Green IT has been done in many countries, except Indonesia. Indonesia has committed to reduce carbon emission by 26% in 2020 and Green IT is one of the potential ways to be implemented to achieve the goal. This proposed paper is going to use survey that has been done previously by RMIT University and Info~Tech to get the level of awareness of Green IT among IT professionals in Indonesia. The results then will be compared to other countries and to highlight the opportunities to increase the awareness level in Indonesia. Following study will be under taken to assess the Green IT readiness index of companies in Indonesia as per Green IT framework developed by previous researchers.
Author Keywords: Awareness; Carbon emissions; CO2; Environmental footprint; Green IT; Readiness
Index Keywords: Information management; Awareness; Carbon emissions; CO2; Environmental footprints; Green IT; Readiness; Knowledge management
